name: muktuk
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the skin and fat of a whale (= a very large sea mammal) cut into small pieces and eaten as food by Inuit people: The whole village comes together in June to eat whale meat and muktuk.
More examplesFewer examplesMuktuk, or raw whale skin and blubber, is a prized delicacy. Three generations gathered at her grandmother's house for caribou soup, fried caribou, musk ox and muktuk . You dip the muktuk in the hot oil sauce and it isn't bad at all.
